excerpts.value: All the washing must be done at home , and dried on the house - top ; different kinds of vegetables are prepared for winter use , and must be dried on the house - top ; * our mats and carpets need airing and beating , and that must be done on the house - top .When we want a little exercise , we shall find purer air and fewer smells on the house - top than in the narrow , dirty streets below ; and when everyone everyone is busy , and the house full of noise and bustle , and we want to be quiet , - ) - we can go alone to the house - top .In Damascus , vines are sometimes trained on trellis - work over one corner of the roof to form a pleasant shade .
words: in the narrow , dirty streets below

excerpts.value: As Ave leave the tOAvn next morning , Ave skirt the orchards Avhich supply a great part of the counrry Avith oranges and lemons .Had Ave only a little time to spare , it Avould be pleasant to spend an hour or tAvo in these gardens , and try to settle to our OAvn satisfaction satisfaction the vexed question , Is the orange , or the apricot , ' the apple of gold , set in pictures of silver ' ? At this season , Ave shad find the air full of the SAveet smell of the orange and lemon - blossoms , and shall be able to gather lovely little bouquets of early roses , maidenhair maidenhair fern , and orange - blossom .These orchards also produce the best bananas in the country , as Avell as citrons , pomegranates , and other fruit ; Avhile here and there a stately palm may be seen raising its lofty head aboAre the other trees .
words: of the orange and lemon - blossoms

excerpts.value: The JeAvs in Damascus number about 5 , 000 or 6 , 000 , and they Hve in a district of the tOAvn lying to the south of the street once caded the Street Straight .* There are feAV ancient remains in their quarter , though we read that from the time of Ahab the children of Israel - f - had possessions in the city ; and at the present day , I am sorry to say , the JeAvish part of the tOAvn is the dirtiest of all , and if Ave pay a visit to some of our JeAvish friends , Ave shad have to pick our Avay through heaps of decaying vegetables and all kinds of rubbish , the odour of Avhich is not very inviting or healthgiving .healthgiving .

CHAPTER VIII .THE COUNTRY ROUND DAMASCUS , The winter in Damascus is sometimes long and dreaiy ; and when the spring comes , all the Damascenes , Jews , Christians and Mohammedans , begin to think it necessary to ' smell the air , ' as their expression is .The Jews begin to visit Jobar , by some thought to be built on the site of the ancient Hobah .

We asked her ' Was there no pasture for their animals there ? ' She ansAvered , ' Yes ; it is a fine plain , and at that season Avas coA ' ered Avith grass but the Arabs have some superstitions superstitions and Avill not pitch their tents or even consent to remain there a feAV hours .' She also described the ascent of one of the mounds as most unpleasant from the stench of Avild beasts .^ * Isa .

Idleness .We find Michael busy receiving his visitors , and his mother and his brother ' s young wife moving about busily waiting upon them , preparing the nargilehs , and when they have lighted them , placing them before both men and women , who take a few whiffs and then politely hand the long tube to their next neighbour .As the people must call on every one of their acquaintance acquaintance named Michael , they are not expected to pay very long visits on this occasion : and Imm Habeeb will soon come in with her pretty tray of sweets .

On the Avest of the Jordan , Avhere the land is far more thickly inhabited , Ave still have vineyards in abundance ; and no nation Avishing in the present day to spy out the land , need send farther than Eshcol * for bunches of grapes such as Europe can hardly equal .In Hebron , a little to the north of Eshcol , Ave might see , perhaps , the most carefully kept and Avellarranged Avellarranged vineyards in the land ; but at this season Ave Avill not tarry in the south even to see the vine - clad mountains near Jerusalem and Bethlehem , but Avill seek one of the highest villages in the Lebanon , where if Ave like Ave can ' smell the air ' and eat grapes all day long .At first , people Avho have never seen a vineyard , or only the vineyards of Italy , may be disappointed ; they Avill probably picture to themselves toavs of large vines , trained on trellis - Avork , Avith beautiful bunches of grapes hanging doAvn ov - erhead , a long series of beautiful arbours ; but the A - ines in Syria are planted in terraces on the mountain - sides i - oav abovTe i - oav , i - oav above row , stretching for miles around some of the villages .

Beyrout cannot yet boast a harbour , or even a pier ; and all the steamers from Europe have to anchor at least half a mile from the shore ; and if Ave return home by Avay of the tOAvn , we shall pass the landing places of fishing and other small boats , and we can look into the Gumruk , or custom - house , the post - offices , etc .; but this part of the tOAvn is neither very clean , nor very fragrant .We must be ready early in the morning for our quiet journey along the sea - shore of Phenicia , ' into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon .
